clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Follow-up of Subjects With Cerebral Adrenoleukodystrophy Who Were Treated With Lenti-D Drug Product
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Follow-up of Subjects With Cerebral Adrenoleukodystrophy Who Were Treated With Lenti-D Drug Product

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a multi-center, long-term safety and efficacy follow-up study for subjects with cerebral adrenoleukodystrophy (CALD) who have received Lenti-D Drug Product in Study ALD-102.
After completing Study ALD-102 (approximately 2 years), eligible subjects will be followed for an additional 13 years for a total of 15 years post-drug product infusion. No investigational drug product will be administered in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall survival of subjects with cerebral adrenoleukodystrophy (CALD) treated with Lenti-D Drug Product
Monitoring neurological status using the Neurological Function Score (NFS)
Monitoring for clinical signs of oncogenesis
Brain magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) (with and without gadolinium enhancement)

Archiving samples and potentially monitoring for the presence of vector-derived replication competent lentivirus (RCL) in archived samples using RCL detection assay, if clinical outcomes are suggestive of retroviral disease
Monitoring for clonal dominance using integration site analysis (ISA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of adrenoleukodystrophy protein (ALDP) expression in peripheral blood
Assessment of vector copy number (VCN) in peripheral blood
Assessment of changes from baseline in very long chain fatty acids (VLCFA) levels in fasting serum
Assessment of changes from baseline in IQ using the age-appropriate test from the Wechsler panel
Health related quality of life assessment (PedsQL)

arm_group.description: Subjects treated with Lenti-D Drug Product in Study ALD-102 (bluebird bio-sponsored clinical trial) and who meet the eligibility criteria for the study LTF-304

intervention.description: Vector copy number (VCN) measurement, safety evaluations, disease-specific assessments, and assessments to monitor for long-term complications of autologous transplant

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with cerebral adrenoleukodystrophy (CALD) who have received Lenti-D Drug Product in Study ALD-102.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of written informed consent for this study by the subject or subject's parent(s)/ legal guardian(s) and written informed assent by subject, if applicable
- Have received Lenti-D Drug Product in Study ALD-102
- Able to comply with study requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Met the VCN discontinuation criterion on Study ALD-102, as follows: the subject has undetectable VCN (<0.0003 copies per cell) in peripheral blood cells for 2 consecutive measurements at least 1 month apart and at least 12 months after drug product infusion.
